title: Calculate energy of bond in O2

content.question:
Bond Type 
Average Bond Enthalpy <math alttext="in kilojoules per mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="C H single bond" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 
414 

<math alttext="C O single bond" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> 
360 

<math alttext="C O double bond" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 
799 

<math alttext="O H single bond" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>O</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> 
464 

The combustion of methane proceeds according to the chemical equation <math alttext="C H 4 plus 2 O 2 react to produce C O 2 plus 2 H 2 O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The table above provides the average bond enthalpy for selected bonds. The calculated enthalpy change for the reaction, <math alttext="delta H, sub r x n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mtext>rxn</mtext></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, is <math alttext="negative 802 kilojoules per mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>802</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following provides the mathematical procedure to estimate the bond enthalpy per mole of <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="one half times, open bracket, negative 802, plus 2 times, open parenthesis, 799, close parenthesis, plus 4 times , open parenthesis, 464, close parenthesis, minus 4 times, open parenthesis, 414, close parenthesis, close bracket, kilojoules per mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>802</mn><mtext> </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>799</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>464</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>−</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>414</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo stretchy="false">]</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 times, open bracket, negative 802, plus 799 plus 2 times, open parenthesis, 464, close parenthesis, minus 2 times, open parenthesis, 414, close parenthesis, close bracket, kilojoules per mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>[</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>802</mn><mo>+</mo><mrow><mrow><mn>799</mn></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>464</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>−</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>414</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one half times, open bracket, negative 802, minus 2 times, open parenthesis, 360, close parenthesis, plus 4 times, open parenthesis, 464, close parenthesis, plus 4, times open parenthesis, 414, close parenthesis, close bracket, kilojoules per mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>802</mn><mo>−</mo><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>360</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>464</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>414</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>]</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 times, open bracket, negative 802, minus 360, plus 2 times, open parenthesis, 464, close parenthesis, plus 414, close bracket, kilojoules per mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>802</mn><mo>−</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mn>360</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>464</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mrow><mn>414</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>]</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="one half times, open bracket, negative 802, plus 2 times, open parenthesis, 799, close parenthesis, plus 4 times , open parenthesis, 464, close parenthesis, minus 4 times, open parenthesis, 414, close parenthesis, close bracket, kilojoules per mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>802</mn><mtext> </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>799</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>464</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>−</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>414</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo stretchy="false">]</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
